titles.title: To direct the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to establish a regional office in a community in the United States located not more than 10 miles from the border between the United States and Mexico.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Small Business.

bill.summary: 5/3/1995--Introduced. Directs the Administrator of the Small Business Administration (SBA) to establish an SBA regional office in a U.S. community located: (1) not more than ten miles from the Mexican border; and (2) as close as practicable to the point halfway between San Diego, California, and Brownsville, Texas.
